result.execSummary:
Mason Sean Maloney was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Mason Sean Maloney was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mason Sean Maloney

records.addlTxt:
1:10 PM Defendant Mason Sean Maloney not in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Mason Sean Maloney.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF88 & 22CM92 tracking together:
Atty Sarbacker isn't appointed on the Felony case so he didn't see any extradition paperwork.  

BY THE COURT:  22CF88 can show closed; defendant was extradited back to Minnesota

22CM92:
Atty Sarbacker asks for another status so he can track down his client.  Atty Juech has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:48 PM Defendant Mason Sean Maloney not in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Mason Sean Maloney.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sarbacker states that the defendant waived extradition at the last hearing; he has not been in contact with his client.  Atty Burdon responds.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
7/25/22:  Bond amended from $15,000.00 cash to $15,000.00 signature

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mason Sean Maloney in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Mason Sean Maloney. 
22CF88, 22CM92

As to 22CF88:  Atty Sarbacker has reviewed the documents for extradition.  Defendant is willing to sign but there are some questions as to the wording.  Recess.  Court in session.
Atty Burdon states the last sentence was removed on the agreement being signed.  Court reviews extradition agreement and questions defendant. Defendant waives his right to have an Extradition Hearing.  Court questions defendant and Atty Sarbacker.  Defendant signs all copies.  BY THE COURT:  Court signs documents.
Atty Burdon moves to amend the cash bond to a signature bond.  BY THE COURT:  Bond amended to signature bond with no special conditions.

As to 22CM92:  State moves to amend to signature bond.  BY THE COURT:  Bond amended to signature bond with no special conditions.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Atty Sarbacker enters Not Guilty plea to all charges in 22CM92.
Set for status.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mason Sean Maloney appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Katie Hayes appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
22CM92 tracking with 22CF88:
Atty Hayes states that the defendant does not waive extradition.  

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Juech asks for a $500 cash bond with conditions on 22CM92.
Atty Hayes makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions on 22CM92:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 


Atty Juech asks for a $15,000 cash bond on 22CF88.  Atty Hayes asks for not more than $1,000 cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $15,000 Cash bond with conditions on 22CF88
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
